meanings.definition: A form of government in which possession of property is a qualification for office.
meanings.sent1: In timocracies, only those who own property can hold positions of power.
meanings.sent2: The timocracies of ancient Greece favored the wealthy in leadership roles.
meanings.sent3: The timocracies in that fictional world required citizens to own land to vote.
meanings.sent4: The timocracies of old were like exclusive clubs for the rich and powerful.
meanings.sent5: Living in timocracies meant that your wealth determined your political influence.

meanings.definition: A political system in which honor is given to wealth.
meanings.sent1: In timocracies, people admire those with riches above all.
meanings.sent2: The society's timocracies led to a culture that valued money over all else.
meanings.sent3: It was comical how the timocracies in that town treated the wealthiest residents like royalty.
meanings.sent4: The timocracies of the past turned wealth into a symbol of power and respect.
meanings.sent5: The timocracies painted a vivid picture of a world where money ruled above all else.
